title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 December 2008 - XWiki
content:

dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:00): hi guys! does anybody know why, after making some modifications in a component, plexus keeps loading the old version?  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:22): so, the problem is with the useravatar macro. i made some modifications on it.  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:22): they reflect when running the tests  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:22): but not when rendering a page  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:23): the behaviour of the rendering engine is just like i wouldn't have changed anything in my useravatar class  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:24): you means it load the right class but en old version of that class ?  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:25): yes  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:27): i even made my class output some ordinary text messages, but it still displays the same thing as in the old version  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:27): I doubt plexus is able to do something like that :) maybe there was a problem on build  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:27): how to you test it ?  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:27): you build the jar ten tou copy parst it in your xe distribution ?  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 14:28): XWiki.vylum was modified by XWiki.vylum (Created user) - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/vylum  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 14:29): XWiki.yangzhaohui was modified by XWiki.yangzhaohui (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/yangzhaohui  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:29): yes  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 14:30): Drafts.URLsResolution was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/URLsResolution  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:31): and if i remove the jar, the macro no longer gets rendered  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:31): are you sure the build completely succeed ?  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:31): can you look at the jar date/time  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:32): (if you have any error even just in test the jar is not created)  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:32): try "mvn clean install"  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:32): to be sure the don't get an old jar  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:34): well, i don't see anything wrong with the jar, it was created a few minutes ago  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:34): you don't have differents version of the same jar ?  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:34): i considered this scenario, too, and i deleted it, and maven created me a new one  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:34): or maybe some leftover in the rendering module  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:35): as at first you add the macro in rendering and not in it's own module  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 14:35): FAQ.international was modified by XWiki.yangzhaohui (Is xwiki support international？) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/international  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:36): well, if there were some leftover, when removing the jar, it would continue to render the macro, right? which thing doesn't happen  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:36): yes  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:37): I don't understand  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:37): doesn't plexus store somewhere the jars it finds in the lib folder?  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:37): in some temporary location  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:37): plexus does not load any jar  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:38): it just use java classloader  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:38): the jars are loaded by your container  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:39): I guess you  are restarting the server when you change the jar, right ?  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:41): of course i restart it,   i put this code in my macro: " resultedBlock = new WordBlock("This is a test message for DEBUG"); " and commented the rest of it, as a result the tests fail because this doesn't match the expected output, so i build the jar skipping the tests, with "mvn install -Dmaven.test.skip=true"  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:41): do you think there is something wrong with this?  
ludobot - (10/12/2008 14:43): null  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:44): no I doubt skiping the test change anything to the jar  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:45): can you add a method to your class  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:45): than open the jar an look at the .class with Eclipse for example to see if you have the method listed  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 14:45): at least we will know if the jar is correct or not  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 14:55): done that, and the new method appears in the jar  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:05): dan\_miron: ok  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:05): so if the jar is correct, the only thing I can think of is some leftover somewhere...  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:06): but if the macro doe not work when you remove the jar...  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:06): this is weird  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:06): hmm  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:07): in fact to work the macro need the component.xml to be found by plexus but it possible you have the class somewhere without component.xml  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:08): can you check if the rendering jar contains your class ?  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 15:08): i think i found the issue  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 15:09): XE was using the xwiki-rendering.jar from the repository  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:09): you mean your local maven repository ?  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 15:10): no, the remote repository, because i see that a newer version appeared there  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:11): how it can be an issue ? the remove rendering moduile does not contains the macro  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:12): remove=remote  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 15:13): XWiki.JohannaHoller was modified by XWiki.JohannaHoller (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/JohannaHoller  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 15:15): my jar contains the macro. this means it was from my local repository  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 15:15): and this what caused the problem  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:18): ok so the problem is that XE contains your old rendering jar, not that it contains the one from remote repository ;)  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:19): you shoudl always use mvn clean install in place of mvn install to build any non jar maven project  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:19): otherwise you will always get issues like this  
dan\_miron - (10/12/2008 15:21): well, i'll take care of that in the future  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:23): you should use the tuto in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse the dependencies are dynamically managed by m2eclipse so you can't get this kind of problems  
thomasmortagne - (10/12/2008 15:23): plus it's easier to build and debug your project  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 15:47): Community.DebugXEWithEclipse\_ImportJarProjects was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse\_ImportJarProjects  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 15:47): Community.DebugXEWithEclipse\_ImportJarProjects was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse\_ImportJarProjects

xwikibot - (10/12/2008 16:02): Community.DebugXEWithEclipse\_Troubleshoots was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse\_Troubleshoots

radex - (10/12/2008 19:56): hi  
ebullient - (10/12/2008 20:43): hey all... it's been awhile  
ebullient - (10/12/2008 20:43): I just noticed behavior I don't understand  
ebullient - (10/12/2008 20:43): ordered list formatting seems to be broken  
ebullient - (10/12/2008 20:43): (on xwiki.org as well)  
ebullient - (10/12/2008 20:44): numbered lists in particular aren't rendered with numbers...  
xwikibot - (10/12/2008 23:59): XWiki.wcsadmin was modified by XWiki.wcsadmin (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/wcsadmin
